title: Anna Kaufmann
text: Anna Kaufmann was a German <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="soprano">soprano</a> who was a principal artist at the <a href="Bavarian%20State%20Opera">Bavarian State Opera</a> in <a href="Munich">Munich</a> from 1869 to 1872. Just prior to her appointment, the great soprano <a href="Mathilde%20Mallinger">Mathilde Mallinger</a> had left the Bavarian State Opera and Kaufmann succeeded her in the roles of Elsa in <a href="Richard%20Wagner">Richard Wagner</a>'s "<a href="Lohengrin%20%28opera%29">Lohengrin</a>", Elisabeth in Wagner's "<a href="Tannh%C3%A4user%20%28opera%29">Tannhäuser</a>", and Eva in Wagner's "<a href="Die%20Meistersinger%20von%20N%C3%BCrnberg">Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg</a>" among other parts. She notably created the roles of Woglinde in Wagner's "<a href="Das%20Rheingold">Das Rheingold</a>" on September 22, 1869, and Fricka in Wagner's "<a href="Die%20Walk%C3%BCre">Die Walküre</a>" on June 26, 1869. Currently, no further biographical details about Kaufmann's life both before and after her time at the Bavarian State Opera have surfaced.
